{"step_by_step_thinking": "Skeletal muscles contract through a process known as the sliding filament theory. This binding causes a conformational change in the troponin-tropomyosin complex, exposing the myosin-binding sites on actin and allowing the myosin heads to bind to actin, initiating contraction.
